title: How to Calibrate the Gyroscope on a Samsung Galaxy: Simple Guide

steps.title: Open your Samsung's Settings menu .
steps.content: Open your Samsung's Settings menu . You can find this gear-shaped icon in your app list.

steps.title: Tap Device care.
steps.content: Tap Device care . This is towards the bottom of the menu. You may need to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Tap Diagnostics.
steps.content: Tap Diagnostics . You can find this underneath the Additional care header.

steps.title: Tap Phone diagnostics.
steps.content: Tap Phone diagnostics . This is the first option. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Sensors.
steps.content: Tap Sensors . You can find this tile near the bottom of the page. Your Galaxy will begin testing your sensors, including the gyroscope. [2] X Research source If this isn't your first time testing the sensors, tap Test again to begin. When the testing is complete, you should see Normal next to "Gyroscope." If you don't see "Gyroscope" listed, your Samsung phone or tablet does not have a gyroscope. [3] X Research source If you don't see this menu, you can calibrate your sensors using the Using the Hidden Menu method or the Using a Third-Party App method. If the sensor test fails, jump down to our troubleshooting tips .

steps.title: Open the Phone dialer.
steps.content: Open the Phone dialer. It's the phone icon on your home screen. You'll be entering a special code in the dialer to access the hidden system menu that lets you test and recalibrate your gyroscope. This method should work on most Samsung Galaxy models, including newer ones that no longer have a gyroscope calibration option in the Settings menu. The exception is that it may not work with certain mobile carriers, including Verizon. If this method doesn't work for you, try the Using a Third-Party App method.

steps.title: Dial #0#.
steps.content: Dial #0 # . Once dialed, you'll see a diagnostic menu with several buttons. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Sensor button.
steps.content: Tap the Sensor button. You'll see this near the middle of the screen. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Place the Galaxy on a flat surface and tap Gyro Selftest.
steps.content: Place the Galaxy on a flat surface and tap Gyro Selftest . This will recalibrate the gyroscope and display the word PASS when complete. If you see FAIL instead of PASS , there is something wrong with your Galaxy's internal hardware. Contact your carrier (or Samsung) if your phone is under warranty for repair options. Tap the back button twice to return to your home screen after recalibration.

steps.title: Open the Play Store .
steps.content: Open the Play Store . You can find the Play Store app in your app list.

steps.title: Download Accelerometer Calibration.
steps.content: Download Accelerometer Calibration. This is a completely free app that will calibrate your gyroscope. To get the app: Type accelerometer calibration free into the search bar and tap the search button. Tap Accelerometer Calibration by RedPi Apps to open its details. [6] X Research source Tap Install . Follow any on-screen instructions to grant the app permission to install.

steps.title: Open Accelerometer Calibration.
steps.content: Open Accelerometer Calibration. If you're still in the Play Store, tap OPEN near the top of the screen to do this. Otherwise, tap the new blue icon with a smartphone inside in your apps list.

steps.title: Tap OK on the welcome screen.
steps.content: Tap OK on the welcome screen. Now you'll see some moving numbers at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Place your Galaxy on a flat surface and tap Calibrate.
steps.content: Place your Galaxy on a flat surface and tap Calibrate . It's the green button at the bottom of the screen. Leave the phone or tablet on the surface until the calibration is complete. When you see a message that says the accelerometer has been calibrated successfully, you'll know your gyroscope has been calibrated.

steps.title: Make sure your Galaxy device has a gyroscope.
steps.content: Make sure your Galaxy device has a gyroscope. Not all models doâ€“for example, like many of the A models, the Samsung Galaxy A14 does not have a gyroscope. [7] X Research source However, some A models, including the A36, do come with a gyroscope sensor. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Restart your device.
steps.content: Restart your device. If it's been a while since you turned off your Samsung phone or tablet, a simple restart can usually fix small software bugs. Turn off your Galaxy device completely, wait a few minutes, and then power it on again.

steps.title: Update your device.
steps.content: Update your device. Make sure you're running the latest version of the Android operating system for your device. This ensures that any bugs on Samsung's end are patched up. You can update your Android by navigating to Settings > System > System Updates . [9] X Research source

steps.title: Contact Samsung if problems persist.
steps.content: Contact Samsung if problems persist. If you're still having issues with the gyroscope on your Galaxy, it may be a hardware issue. In this case, you can contact Samsung support for additional help or replacement parts.
